From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To trace error recovery in memory using caches through set options, use the **memory cache error-recovery options** command in global configuration mode. To disable the set memory cache error recovery mechanisms, use the **no** form of this command.
CLIs: memory cache error-recovery options { abort-if-same-content | blocking-mode | max-recoveries<value> | nvram-report | parity-check | window <seconds> }
no memory cache error-recovery options { abort-if-same-content | blocking-mode | max-recoveries<value> | nvram-report | parity-check | window <seconds> }

ParaDef.Info: Abort recovery if the cache contains the same content as the memory.
Sets the memory blocking mode to special or ON.
The maximum number of recoveries allowed within a time window. Specify a value in the range 0 to 255.
Saves the report in the NVRAM.
Sets the parity checking mode to normal or ON.
The time window, in seconds. Specify a value in the range 1 to 31536000.

Examples: The following example shows how to enable the memory cache error-recovery options command:
Router(config)# memory cache error-recovery options abort-if-same-content

RelatedCmds.description: Traces error recovery in memory using caches.
